thread.title: Ex-worker reaches plea agreement in behavioral health agency embezzlement
thread.title_full: Albuquerque Journal | Ex-worker reaches plea agreement in behavioral health agency embezzlement

author: Deborah Baker / Journal Staff Writer
title: Ex-worker reaches plea agreement in behavioral health agency embezzlement
text:
A former worker at a Santa Fe-based behavioral health agency has reached a plea agreement with prosecutors on charges of embezzlement and attempted tax evasion.
Ricardo Franco will be required to pay $30,000 in restitution to Easter Seals El Mirador and more than $10,000 in back taxes under the agreement approved this week by a state District Court judge in Santa Fe.
He will not face any prison time under the agreement. A sentencing hearing is scheduled Nov. 2.
Franco, of Rio Rancho, was a financial specialist in the agencyâ€™s payroll division. The agency fired him after it discovered the embezzlement, which occurred between 2010 and 2013.
The case was unrelated to a 2013 crackdown by the Human Services Department on Easter Seals and 14 other nonprofits serving the mentally ill and addicted. HSD halted their Medicaid funding, replaced most of them with Arizona companies, and referred them to the attorney general for investigation of possible fraud.
Easter Seals has been cleared by the attorney general and remains in business serving the developmentally disabled.
